f6_assessments.q0: A commendable effort and noble intent by the proposer. Start educating them young would be the plan that should be generally used. In this proposal's case they intend to equip teachers with online courses on programming that would have a duration of 3 (three) months, which culminates in those teachers creating a Cardano club that teaches Haskell. This is too ambitious of a program. 3 (three) months would probably cover just the basics of any functional program. There would not be enough time to master it in such a way that it can be meaningfully applied or taught to. Then there's Haskell, renown amongst developers as a language that is extremely difficult. Reckon what would be best for this proposer is to scale down and target less. Take things slow in Africa would be key and the gist of this proposal is actually something currently being proposed by other communities from Africa. Would recommend to collaborate with WADA (an African centric Cardano community) or to seek out African proposals in the Challenge Community Events.
f6_assessments.q1: Unfortunately only a name of an entity is given. Other than that, no credentials statement and no links are provided. Budget is also not broken down, an implementation plan is provided, though it is categorized as KPI's. There is also no timetable provided, equally important no risk and future challenge are assessed. The spirit to propose is truly beautiful, unfortunate the technical know-how on the method of proposing a proposal is not there yet. Highly recommend to also get in contact with Catalyst School that will provide free education on how to write and submit a proposal. Their workshops are also available online in their YouTube channel, please do have a look.
f6_assessments.q2: There is some form of roadmap and implementation plan, also measurable KPI's but all are intertwined. Making it difficult for CA's to break down and assess correctly. Though from what is given, this proposal is unfortunately not auditable. Problem statement and solution are also vague, which eventually effected the proposal's quality. Please do comeback with a future iteration but prior to that to contact WADA and Catalyst School.

f6_assessments.q0:
Training math teachers to teach the basics of functional programming is an interesting way, but I don't think it's feasible and effective for teachers and students.
Why try to train math teachers in functional Programming to teach kids and not teachers with expertise in computers and programming? I think math teachers should focus on teaching kids math well rather than learning to teach kids programming.
The idea of the proposal is to make math teachers waste time with something else they're not good at: functional programming. Because functional programming knowledge requires experience to be taught, when math teachers try to teach functional programming, there will be a lot of problems.
f6_assessments.q1: This this proposal needs a clear description of the plan, how it would do it, when it would do it by, how the budget would be spent and evidence the proposer has the skills to deliver. I don't see any information about the team (even a name). So this proposal doesn't seem feasible
f6_assessments.q2: Without a detailed proposal on how this would be delivered with milestones and timelines it is not possible to audit this proposal. What is success? Key metrics should include volumes lent, default rates, interest rates charged/received etc.

f6_assessments.q0: First of all, I would like to thank you for suggesting this humane and ethical idea. Besides, I also have a few small suggestions, at the moment I do not see how teaching math teachers to be taught Programming will be useful for children here. Also, is learning programming really an essential need? And will it meet the need to learn programming while requiring a large number of computers to be able to learn. In the future I would like to suggest that children have enough infrastructure to learn and grow, then we can accommodate teaching or directing them to be more tech-savvy as the world evolves.
f6_assessments.q1: In addition to the experience stated Education Advisor ICT, I would like the team to be able to provide documents about themselves as well as qualifications for implementation. In addition, with a request fee of up to $ 20000, how would you suggest using this money? And building a community of teachers learning to programming in the short and long term.
f6_assessments.q2: I hope you can implement the roadmap when funded with the corresponding KPI. For example, if select 100 Mathematics Teachers to be trained from data bases and requests from Country Teachers Services Commissions, how long will it take, and with what budget, who will perform the task. Whether training teachers for a period of 3 months is enough to ensure professional knowledge and teaching quality. Tell us more

f6_assessments.q0:
1. A problem to be solved is identified, but it is not clear why it should be solved. Intuitively, it can be stated that it is necessary to train teachers, but the need to instruct them in programming is not clear.
2. It is also not clear what value it would add to the Cardano ecosystem, since the simple training of mathematics teachers does not generate any impact.
3. You need to develop the key objectives.
4. The proposal can be expanded and improved for future challenges.
